page.title: 07THE BLACKSMITH AT MONTFORD
page.content:
Mr Richard Roberts has been a blacksmith at Montford Bridge for more than 50 years. Born in the village he became an apprentice blacksmith in his teens. In those days work came from local farms because nearly every village had its own blacksmith. Today, however, with the decline of blacksmiths, his catchment area covers villages up to 20 miles away.
Mr. Roberts says the work has also changed. "When I began, the work was all furnace work; shoeing horses and wheelrighting. Today it's nearly all work for an electric welder like making gates and wagons for farms and carrying out repairs on modern farm implements". Mr. Roberts still enjoys his work and would like to see more young people interested in the profession.
